bibl.title: Letter from Sally L. Jean to Emilie Lawrence Reed, June 14, 1927

div1.p: Jean requests Emilie Lawrence Reed's help in creating an educational film strip on Walter Reed.

div1.head: Letter from Sally L. Jean to Emilie Lawrence Reed, June 14, 1927
div1.opener:
Metropolitan Life Insurance Company
Haley Fish President
New York City June 14, 1927
Welfare Division
LEE K. FRANKEL
SECOND VICE-PRESIDENT
IN REPLYING, PLEASE REFER TO FILE No.
Mrs. Walter Reed
The Burlington
Vermont Avenue at Thomas Circle
Washington, D. C.
My dear Mrs. Reed:
div1.p:
Your interest in the life of your husband
which we have published for the use of school children
has made me feel that it was possible to call on you
for cooperation in a project we now have under way.

We propose to develop a series of film
strips, covering the lives of Pasteur, Trudeau, Jenner
and Reed. These strips will be used in Junior and
Senior High School classrooms all over the country in
connection with the instruction in regard to the lives
of these health heroes.

The series on the life of Pasteur is com-
pleted, and we are anxious to begin the Reed strip.
We require photographs of Walter Reed during his child-
hood, and also any other family photographs which are
available. Could you help us secure photographs or
supply us with data which would help us either to have
posed photographs taken or to give to an artist? We
are sending you a copy of the Pasteur strip, which will
give you an idea of the way in which we hope to depict
the incidents in the life of Walter Reed.
We will appreciate your advice and cooperation.

closer.signed:
Sally Lucas Jean
HEALTH EDUCATION CONSULTANT
